messages.subject: R: [samuraihistory] informations about GENGO
messages.msgSnippet: This year is Heisei 16, according to the Nengo dating system. See here for Nengo and other japanese dating systems :
messages.messageBody:
This year is Heisei 16, according to the Nengo dating system.
See here for Nengo and other japanese dating systems :
http://www.meiboku.demon.co.uk/guide/index.htm


-----Messaggio originale-----
Da: Daniele Frison [mailto:eriel666@...]
Inviato: domenica 15 febbraio 2004 16.15
A: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Oggetto: [samuraihistory] informations about GENGO


Could someone of you tell me some informations about the dating sistem
known as "gengou" or "nengou". I know it was adopted in japan since VII
century (Taika Reform) and it was interrupted in 1947 with the
institution of the constitution. I also know that in 1979 Ohira
Masayoshi decided for the not obligatoriness of the use of this dating
sistem. Now, all I want to know is how this sistem works.

Sorry for the long preface!

Salut!

Daniele





---------------------------------
Do you Yahoo!?

messages.subject: Hello!  New to the Group.
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings, My name is Amy, occasionally known as Saiaiko, and I ve been lurking in the shadows for a bit.  Probably, I ll stay there until I feel I have
messages.messageBody:
Greetings,

My name is Amy, occasionally known as Saiaiko, and I've been lurking
in the shadows for a bit. Probably, I'll stay there until I feel I
have something to contribute, but I wanted to introduce myself.

I am very interested in the late Heian - early Kamakura periods,
specifically the Gempei War. I have recently acquired a fine yumi,
optimistically named Benkei, and am currently learning technique. I
have enjoyed your discussions so far, especially the passionate
ones, and I look forward to learning from them.

Thank you.

~ Amy

PS: Is it kosher to post a background I created in the Files area?
